column4: hi, i just rented a server that runs on ubuntu 10.10, luckyly i have not used ubuntu before :), it supposed to have apatche running on it, how do i check if its true, i have ssh access and also i can use webmin(not that i really know how to use them)
use top
what means 'use top'?
type this - top | grep apache
in the screen in front of you. you should see something like this - enc@renc-server:~$
with a blinking cursor
im on windows, and i need to do it remotely, currently have winscp running as commander layout
the | symbol is above the Enter key where the \ key is placed. Press Shift+
the | symbol is above the Enter key where the \ key is placed. Press Shift+\ key
thank you
so did - top | grep apache trun up anything?
*turn
it kinda froze the putty
that means that apache2 is not running
if this command gives you no output, then it's not installed
it didnt freez it just gave me an empty line
ok thank you
not installed or not running
you are welcome
if you are using webmin in specific then -
where do i type it?
the line: top | grep apache still kinda froze my putty, cant type anyting
if apache is not running, then it will not show any output. Press Ctrl+C to get out of that freeze state
